> 
>> 
>> There's a whole continuum of self-descriptiveness, and
>> some p=
arts of an interaction do not necessarily need visibility. For
>> example, =
if my API requires clients to include headers for their
>> star-sign...
>> =

> 
> All parts of a RESTful system require self-descriptive messaging, it'=
s
> a constraint.  Any application-specific headers that intermediaries
> h=
ave no need to consider to determine how to process a message, have no
> be=
aring on self-descriptiveness.

How are you determining whether or not a gi=
ven header needs to be considered by an intermediary? What if I need a prox=
y distributing requests through my system dependant on the client's star si=
gn?

I think it might help if you share some extracts from the dissertation=
 that back up the point you are trying to make.
